snippet: Prime Minister Cheick Modibo Diarra’s resignation cast new doubt on plans to chase out radical Islamists who control much of the West African nation.
abstract: Soldiers arrest Mali Prime Min Cheick Modibo Diarra and force his resignation; experts say Diarra's arrest confirms that army junta remained in power despite appearance of civilian government, reality that complicates planned military aid meant to help army wrest northern Mali from radical Islamists.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Cheick Modibo Diarra’s resignation cast new doubt on plans to chase out radical Islamists who control much of the West African nation.

headline.seo: Cheick Modibo Diarra, Mali’s Prime Minister, Resigns After Arrest
headline.main: Mali’s Prime Minister Resigns After Arrest, Muddling Plans to Retake North
headline.print_headline: Mali’s Prime Minister Resigns After Arrest, Muddling Plans to Retake North

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
